intro: Cyclamen europaeum var. ponticum, commonly known as the Persian cyclamen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It features distinctive heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and striking, spurred flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with its foliage emerging from a tuberous root system. It thrives in cool, shady environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its winter blooms. Cyclamen europaeum var. ponticum is well-suited for indoor cultivation and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
